segments.text: Excuse me , have you got any laundry ? The laundryman is here to collect it .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , I have . Here are my blouse , coats and stockings .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , yes . My husband also has some laundry . This is his suit and here is his pajamas .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , no . Only the suit and coat are to be dry-cleaned . I want to have my blouse tomorrow evening . And I'd like the collar and cuffs starched .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , but not too stiff , right ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Exactly . Is it possible to have my overcoat dry-cleaned , too ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: There are a few spots on it . I am afraid you will not have it tomorrow . Dry-cleaning usually takes three days .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , no . I also need this tomorrow evening .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: In that case , I suppose I could ask the dry-cleaner to clean up the spots for the moment , and have it well pressed . You might get it back on time then .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: By the way , a cotton came off your shirt you gave me the day before yesterday .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: The laundry has sewed on a new button for you .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I am afraid the new one is not exactly the same as the others .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: If you have any more laundry , please just leave it in the laundry bag behind the bathroom door . The laundryman comes to collect it every morning .
segments.speaker: S1
